Oh my! Everything was soooo gooood! Stop here after reading great reviews, was not disappointed! Very small inside ,it was raining when we visited so we had to wait for a table. We like this casual smokehouse tucked into the middle of La Jolla's shopping district. Tri tip is sliced thin, not thick, but flavor is good with their baked potatoes. Beef ribs and fried dill pickles are also great. Casual atmosphere with good service and quality ingredients.

Great food- I had the slider trio and was very pleased. Very reasonably priced for such yummy food. Staff was very nice and I'm very happy I stopped in for a quick lunch.

The Hyatt is doing a great disservice to its paying customers by booking this venue out all the time for private functions. People who come to the hotel want to benefit from this, and take this into consideration when they book their rooms. Then to have it taken up with private functions, and not accessible is a ruse.

This is a beautiful spot to sit down and have a quick bite. The selection is slim but for bites they have Grass Fed Beef sliders. Not an easy thing to find, but a great healthy option. It looks as though most of the menu caters to locally sourced and healthier foods.

A bit expensive, but the views at sunset are just outstanding! You can see Coronado, the bay, as well as some of downtown..!

I hadn't realized I had not posted this review back in April when my wife and I spent a week at the Hyatt for her 50th Birthday.
Well the excellent service and superb attitude of of the staff we dealt with means I cannot leave the review unfinished even some 9 months on.

More  



Top of the Hyatt provides great views. Service and ambiance was good as well. Drink menu was adequate albeit overpriced. Go for one and enjoy the view - then move on to better spots in Gaslamp.

Cool views, but with outrageous prices. Worth it to go for a drink, take a picture and then get out of there

Although the place is always enjoyable, the quality of the food (snacks) could be much better. The service is good and the views of SD are outstanding. I will only go back if I stay again in the Hotel.

this place was just a tad on the expensive side, but the panoramic view of the entire San Diego bay made everything just right!

Had an awesome time with an out of town friend, enjoyed the view and cocktails,,service was top notch!

Beautiful setting. Tables, couches and window seats. Go early for a window seat. Outstanding view. The drinks were great, the help was very nice and friendly and the appetizers were just right for a 5:00 snack. Definitely worth taking the time to ride the elevator

Our experience here was quite good. Our reception was very warm and welcoming and our server was very attentive. The food is very good and tasty. Portions are plentiful. They also put a large bowl of chips and 2 dips on the table when you sit down.

We ate at Miguel's on Coronado Island. You must try the Millionaire Margaritas. Best I have ever had. The food and service was good also.

We are from Iowa and met a family from San Diego there. There were ten people & they said we should order something different. We all shared the different dishes, and they were all outstanding! never saw so much great food, the Margs. were very good. wish we had this place in Des Moines

If you like a Caesar Salad be sure to try Barb's Salad. It's a huge portion and it's packed full of grilled shrimp, avocado, carnitas, and a wonderful Cheese bread on the side. Be sure to check out their queso served with the chips and salsa. You'll definitely go back for more.

While visiting Old Town San Diego we stopped in for lunch before hitting the road back to LA. The food was delicious and the service was great. Took a friend here to enjoy the stuffed sandwiches. Had a torpedo roll filled with delicious fettuccine, broccoli and cream sauce. My torpedo was filled with an antipasto salad and was so much fun to eat -and delicious! Delicious Tortuga desert with fresh brewed organic coffee. Love this place!

Very tasty pastas served inside crispy bread, a good please to sit down and get service after a long, tiring day in SeaWorld park.

I'm vegan so I was happy to see that they had a vegan dish and our waiter was nice enough to warn me that their candy had butter. It was good and interesting to eat pasta inside my toasted bread.

A must stop when in SD. A great combination of flavors and textures with pasta/salad and sesame toasted bread. Great selection of local craft beers and a 4-6 pm weekday happy hour specials?

The sandwiches are amazing and different. My grandkids love eating a spaghetti and meatballs sandwich or a salad sandwich. The food is delicious, the coffee is fresh, good beers on tap. One of my favorite lunch places in San Diego!

My partner and I ate at Devine Pastabilities while on vacation from Australia. Our meals were amazing, the pasta was so tasty and fresh, amazing in a sub roll. It was fun to have something a bit different, my boyfriend felt like someone had put his childhood dreams into restaurant form. We would highly recommend this restaurant to others.

Family came here while on vacation and it was the best meal we had all week! Everything comes in 6 or 12 inch Italian bread. Great atmosphere, very nice service, good food and great beer selection. Great place to spend your time and money. Looking forward to returning!

We wanted to try something different while in San Diego . The food is unique and great. The waiter were fun and friendly. If you are a family attending Marine graduation this is a must stop!

If you are in the Midway district of San Diego , you must go to here. The signature sandwich THE TORPASTA is excellent with excellent service and a great wait staff. go there every chance I get.
